page.title: 03Landscape,The Weald Moors
page.content: This is a sparsely settled agricultural area.The Weald Moors, formerly extensive wooded marshland have been cleared and drained since the 16 th century.Early complex systems of channels(strines) were simplified and improved in the 19 th century when a few large channels e.g The Commision Drain were constructed. The river Strine flows westward through the NW of the sector.Roads across the moors are often straight but narrow and uneven,they are raised above the level of adjoining fields. The nucleated village of Kynnersley lies on higher land,above 55 m.The parish church,Manor House and five farms are important features of this settlement.The are approx 40 houses in the village,most having been built during or since the 19 th century.
